page.title: 19GRANGE FARM
page.content: {Grange Farm}is owned by{Mr Holloway. He milks the cows electrically, and the average yield of milk per year is 422,644 litres. Mr Holloway also makes 10,000 bales of hay, 20,000 bales of straw, 50 tons of barley and 130 tons of wheat per year. Mr Holloway grows three different crops: grass, hay and corn. He has sixteen fields and two hundred acres of land. Mr Holloway has four full-time workers, one is a dairy worker and the others are tractor drivers. Mr Holloway has been a farmer all his life and has seven tractors, a copmbine harvester, a silage maker and calving equipment. Another interesting fact about Grange Farm is that he has a hedge that is nine hundred years old, which dates back to the original "Domesday Book".
